definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Perhaps you want to document the full scope of your cross-industry experience, much of which occurred in your early career.
sentences.chinese: 或许你更早的一些的工作是在比较有名气的公司里。

sentences.english: It has just come to our notice that the Japanese camera canon manufactured by seiki- kogaku, tokyo, is very popular.
sentences.chinese: 久闻东京精机光学厂生产的“佳能”照相机颇有名气。

sentences.english: He was just starting to become known on the cabaret circuit .
sentences.chinese: 他在卡巴莱歌舞表演圈中刚刚开始有点名气。

sentences.english: I'd say the tea of Fuliang is more famous.
sentences.chinese: 我倒是觉得浮梁茶的名气比较大。

sentences.english: Tianyijiao Food Street besides the sculpture on crossing of Wuma Street is very famous.
sentences.chinese: 五马街口雕塑边上的天一角食街小吃很有名气。

sentences.english: It gets a really nice reception at a very good publisher.
sentences.chinese: 受到颇有名气的出版商的青睐。

sentences.english: Create a "XX Music Channel V" precedent, a minor celebrity at school.
sentences.chinese: 开创“XX音乐榜中榜”先例，在校内小有名气。

sentences.english: After a 10 years journey, he returned to France a famous man.
sentences.chinese: 经过10年的历程后，他回到法国，名气大振。

sentences.english: Mr. Pinto is a well-known figure in Silicon Valley in his own right.
sentences.chinese: 平托先生依靠他自身的能力，在硅谷有一定名气。

sentences.english: It was a famous drug store, and contained one of the first private telephone booths ever erected.
sentences.chinese: 这是家很有名气的药店，装有私人电话间。

sentences.english: It brought Alcott fame and a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 奥尔科特的名气带来了很多钱。

sentences.english: So I have credits, people know me, they recognize me.
sentences.chinese: 我有名气，人们知道我，认识我。

sentences.english: Chinese supermodel Liu Wen is still in shock over her history-making rise to fame.
sentences.chinese: 中国超级名模刘雯仍然其名气的历史性上升而震惊。

sentences.english: A noted celestial burial master would make up to 30,000 Yuan a month.
sentences.chinese: 一个有名气的天葬师一个月能收入近三万元。

sentences.english: During her college years, she also established a reputation as an artist in both photography and multimedia.
sentences.chinese: 大学期间，她就在摄影和多媒体方面小有名气。

sentences.english: My kind of fame not very long, but long enough.
sentences.chinese: 我的名气不会很久，但是也足够久了。

definition: well-known for sth/to become well known/to make one's mark
to make one's name/to become famous
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to have the power to rally supporters
